content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
---------------------
### Copper Cable Factory at (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of following entities:
• Burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) placed using direction RIGHT to interface with the factory.
• Factory burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) (listed as a neighbour) providing an upstream connection.
• Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5) serving as the primary input.
• Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) linked as the production output.

### Belt Depot for Extraction Connection at (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of following entities:
• Wooden chest depot placed at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) to act as an isolated belt target.
• Transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) positioned adjacent to the chest for material routing.
• Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) (using direction UP) to feed items from the depot.

### Extraction System at (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of following entities:
• Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with its drop position at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5) to serve as the source for transporting copper plates.

ERROR TIPS
---------------------
• Belt Connection Errors:
 – When connecting transport belts, the target must be a valid inserter rather than a steam engine. Always attach an inserter to funnel items into the target entity.

• Placement Range Errors:
 – Ensure you are within the placement range of the target position. If an entity (e.g. wooden chest at (3.5,15.5)) cannot be placed due to distance, move closer before attempting placement.

• Inventory Shortfall Errors:
 – Confirm the required item (such as a wooden chest) is present in the inventory before issuing a placement command.

• Undefined Variable Errors:
 – Verify that all variables (for example, target_chest) are correctly defined and in scope prior to usage to avoid NameError faults.
